wikipedia_page.main: John Disney (29 May 1779 – 6 May 1857) was an English barrister and antiquarian. He was elected Fellow of the Royal Society in 1832 and Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries in 1839.

response: The Disney Professorship of Archaeology is an endowed chair in archaeology at the University of Cambridge. It was endowed by John Disney in 1851 with a donation of £1,000, followed by a further £2,500 bequest upon his death in 1857.

link_mentions.page: List of professorships at the University of Cambridge

response: * John Disney (Unitarian) (1746–1816), English Unitarian minister and biographical writer
